modules.name: model_driven_development
recommendedLiterature: Jos B. Warmer and Anneke G. Kleppe, The Object Constraint Language: Getting Your Models Ready for MDA, Addison-Wesley Object Technology Series, 2003

modules.name: higher_level_computer_vision
recommendedLiterature: Goodfellow et al..: Deep Learning, MIT Press, 2016.
R. Szeliski: Computer Vision Algorithms and Applications, Springer, 2010.
D. Forsyth, J. Ponce: Computer Vision: A Modern Approach, Prentice Hall, 2nd edition, 2012.
R. Hartley, A. Zisserman: Multiple View Geometry in Computer Vision, Cambridge University Press, 2nd edition, 2004.
modules.additionalPrerequisite: Basis skills in linear algebra, basis knowledge in python and pytorch

modules.name: image_processing
recommendedLiterature: R. Szeliski: Computer Vision Algorithms and Applications, Springer, 2010.
D. Forsyth, J. Ponce: Computer Vision: A Modern Approach, Prentice Hall, 2nd edition, 2012.
modules.additionalPrerequisite: Basis skills in linear algebra, basis knowledge in python

modules.name: cryptography_ii
recommendedLiterature: Jonathan Katz, Yehuda Lindell: Introduction to Modern Cryptography: Principles and Protocols, Chapman and Hall/CRC, 2007.
modules.additionalPrerequisite: Cryptography I is not required but the basics are recapitulated.

modules.name: cryptography
recommendedLiterature: Christof Paar, Bart Preneel, Jan Pelzl: Understanding Cryptography: A Textbook for Students and Practitioners, Springer 2009.
Douglas R. Stinson: Cryptography - Theory and Practice, Taylor & Francis, 2005.
Alan G. Konheim: Cryptography: A Primer, John Wiley & Sons, 1981.
modules.additionalPrerequisite: Basis skills in linear algebra, probability theory, algorithms, and data structures

modules.name: types_and_programming_languages
recommendedLiterature: Types and Programming Languages. February 2002. Benjamin C. Pierce. The MIT Press. ISBN: 978-0-262-16209-8
